footer.description: Phi was developed as part of the New Normal education programme at Strelka Institute for Media, Architecture and Design.

chat: What is Phi?
Phi is an easy-to-use environment for simulating, finding investment for, and managing clean and decentralized energy systems.
In the transition from fossil fuels, we need to create, store, and use electricity in more collaborative ways.
With Phi everyone can run collaborative energy projects on the blockchain.
Reimagine renewable energy.
With Phi you can simulate P2P energy systems.
Add generators and peers to the map, and see what it takes to power the network.
Test different ideas before submitting projects for investment.
Crowdfund shared infrastructure.
Grow the value of clean and decentralized energy.
Phi helps new projects find investment, and communities select simulations to build.
Groups can chat about proposals, and vote to allocate shared funds.
Create clean networks.
After investment, projects can be built.
Peers collaborate to manage shared infrastructure, reach collective desicions, design smart contracts, and exchange tokens.
Tokens keep track of electricity that moves through the network.
This way we can reward behaviour that supports everyone, from consuming less power, to keeping batteries connected.
Reorganize energy systems.
The transition from fossil fuels needs new ways of working together.
Phi will be the first DAO dedicated to developing and managing renewable energy systems in a collaborative way.
Phi Coin, our core token, will be used in all aspects of governing the network.
An organizational structure based on active P2P connections will make it easy for everyone to take part.
Get in touch
Say hello@phi.is
Join our slack at phiprojectteam.slack.com
Develop Phi together at github.com/phiproject
